New Records: Germany achieved their highest ever score in a European Championship match with a 5-1 victory.
Florian Wirtz became Germany's youngest scorer in the European Championship at 21 years old.
Niclas Füllkrug scored twice on his debut, and Emre Can also scored his first goal for Germany.
Key Match Events: Scotland's Ryan Porteous received a red card after a challenge on Ilkay Gündogan, reducing them to 10 men.
Kai Havertz converted a penalty to give Germany a two-goal lead after halftime.
Antonio Rüdiger scored an own goal for Scotland in the 84th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany's captain Ilkay Gündogan expressed confidence before the match, which was realized with the victory.
The match was seen as an ideal start for Germany to boost their tournament confidence.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany's coach Julian Nagelsmann praised the team's performance and the early confidence boost.
Scotland's manager Steve Clarke expressed disappointment and set expectations for their upcoming matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the Euro 2024 curtainraiser and was held at Allianz Arena in Munich.
Notable guests included German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier and Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán.
